comment: Used both in frontend and backend. language property of an environment must match the monaco editor language property : https://github.com/microsoft/monaco-editor/tree/main/src/basic-languages

codeWriting.label: CUnit and RegExp validator
codeWriting.description: Validate the student code with standard I/O tests, CUnit tests and regular expressions

solution.content:
CXX=g++
CXXFLAGS=-Wall -I.
LIBS=-lcunit

all: main run_tests regex_validator

string_utils.o: string_utils.cpp string_utils.h
	$(CXX) -c string_utils.cpp $(CXXFLAGS)

main.o: main.cpp string_utils.h
	$(CXX) -c main.cpp $(CXXFLAGS)

main: main.o string_utils.o
	$(CXX) -o main main.o string_utils.o

test_main.o: test_main.cpp string_utils.h
	$(CXX) -c test_main.cpp $(CXXFLAGS)

run_tests: string_utils.o test_main.o
	$(CXX) -o run_tests test_main.o string_utils.o $(LIBS)

regex_validator: regex_validator.cpp
	$(CXX) -o regex_validator regex_validator.cpp -std=c++17

clean:
	rm -f *.o main run_tests regex_validator

.PHONY: all clean

solution.content:
CC=gcc
CFLAGS=-Wall -I.
LIBS=-lcunit

all: main run_tests regex_validator

string_utils.o: string_utils.c string_utils.h
	$(CC) -c string_utils.c $(CFLAGS)

main.o: main.c string_utils.h
	$(CC) -c main.c $(CFLAGS)

main: main.o string_utils.o
	$(CC) -o main main.o string_utils.o $(LIBS)

test_main.o: test_main.c string_utils.h
	$(CC) -c test_main.c $(CFLAGS)

run_tests: string_utils.o test_main.o
	$(CC) -o run_tests test_main.o string_utils.o $(LIBS)

regex_validator: regex_validator.c
	$(CC) -o regex_validator regex_validator.c -std=c11

clean:
	rm -f *.o main run_tests regex_validator

.PHONY: all clean

CC=gcc
CFLAGS=-Wall -I.
LIBS=-lcunit

all: main run_tests regex_validator

string_utils.o: string_utils.c string_utils.h
	$(CC) -c string_utils.c $(CFLAGS)

main.o: main.c string_utils.h
	$(CC) -c main.c $(CFLAGS)

main: main.o string_utils.o
	$(CC) -o main main.o string_utils.o $(LIBS)

test_main.o: test_main.c string_utils.h
	$(CC) -c test_main.c $(CFLAGS)

run_tests: string_utils.o test_main.o

codeWriting.label: JavaScript Unit Tests and RegExp Validator

testCases.exec: cd src && cd src && npm test
testCases.expectedOutput:
> src@1.0.0 test
> node --test --test-reporter ./customReporter.js

Test converts "hello" to uppercase: passed
Test converts "world1" to uppercase: passed
Test converts to uppercase: passed

codeWriting.label: Python Pytest and RegExp Validator
codeWriting.description: Validate the student code with standard I/O tests, pytest unit tests, and regular expressions

solution.content:
import sys
from string_functions import to_uppercase
for line in sys.stdin:
    print(to_uppercase(line), end="")

def to_uppercase(input):
    return input.upper()

from string_functions import to_uppercase

def test_upper():
    assert to_uppercase('hello') == 'HELLO'
    assert to_uppercase('world1') == 'WORLD1'
    assert to_uppercase('') == ''

import sys
import re

with open(sys.argv[1]) as f:
    data = f.read()

pattern = sys.stdin.readline().strip()
if re.search(pattern, data):
  print('REGEXP PASS')
else:
    print('REGEXP FAILED')

template.content:
import sys
from string_functions import to_uppercase
for line in sys.stdin:
    print(to_uppercase(line), end="")

def to_uppercase(input):
    return input

from string_functions import to_uppercase

def test_upper():
    assert to_uppercase('hello') == 'HELLO'
    assert to_uppercase('world1') == 'WORLD1'
    assert to_uppercase('') == ''

import sys
import re

with open(sys.argv[1]) as f:
    data = f.read()

pattern = sys.stdin.readline().strip()
if re.search(pattern, data):
  print('REGEXP PASS')
else:
    print('REGEXP FAILED')
